text:
I could have begun with a purple hue, Dipped in the nighttime luster – Though you may not have cared To see the color through.

I could have shown some shaded leaves Strangely lit beneath the dusk, Falling as silent droplets drop To smooth the jagged earth.

I could have sung a midnight thrush Tut, tut, oh-lay-oh-leeeee! It’s liquid trill precise and clean, It’s flutelike song so quickly hushed.

But I began with the bonewhite path, With steps of dust and shadow Past sleeping limbs, now darkly green, In a dappled moonlit glow.
